channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned car vandalised on Wrottesley Road, 27th January
item.description:
This car hasn’t moved for the past year and it’s now been vandalised in the last 12 hours. I walk past it everyday and saw the smashed window on my way home at around 8pm 26th January 2026. Car is opposite 78B Wrottesley Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Six Lamp posts off in a row between Lensbury Way and Wolvercote Road, 27th January
item.description:
Six Lamp posts have been off in a row between Lensbury Way and Wolvercote Road (closer to Wolvercote Road) for the last couple of months, making this pedestrian walkway dark and potentially dangerous, can they be turned back on / fixed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 27th January
item.description:
Someone is throwing black bags and general household waste or business waste over the gates to the electrical station ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge, 27th January
item.description:
A huge fridge and a Xmas tree have been dumped right next to our bins ready for collection.. can they please be removed? Can the street cameras be used to figure out who did it? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bentley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed vehicle, 27th January
item.description:
The vehicle has been parked right on the corner on double yellow lines. This vehicle was parked in Shieldhall Street last week. It has hand written notes in it saying flat battery and is full of rubbish(blankets/clothing). Today it was in this new location. Still has notes saying flat battery. Some of the rubbish has been taken out and dumped on the pavement alongside it. It is also untaxed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Abbey Grove, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain puddle covers the underpass entirely, 27th January
item.description:
It has been here for a long while. When rains the water accumulates under the bridge and it is impossible to pass. The water is quite deep and unsafe to walk through. I am using the path with a pram and water can touch the underneath compartment.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garrick Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lighring not working, AGAIN, 27th January
item.description:
After almost 2 months withou lights, the issue was resolved for two weeks. Now, they aren't working again... let's hope this time it won't take 2 months to be fixed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridge Close, Greater London

item.title: Unpainted roundabout, 27th January
item.description:
The roundabout at the top of Normanhurst Road and on Brampton road no longer looks like a roundabout. It needs to be painted. I drive down Normanhurst every morning but instead of oncoming traffic stopping to allow right of way the cars generally do not stop and drive on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on pavement and grassed areas needs clearing, 27th January
item.description:
Litter on pavement and grassed areas needs clearing along Southborough Lane both sides from BYMT and Southborough Primary school all the way until Petts Wood high street/ Petts Wood library. So much rubbish scattered around by the wing and foxes and nerds clearing asap, thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole a safety issue for pedestrians, 27th January
item.description:
Please fix a large pothole that presents a safety issue for pedestrians. It is located on a crossing of Oxhawth Crescent and Southborough Lane, on the Oxhawth Crescent side. Many school children and adults cross this area and can injure themselves as the pothole on the road is really deep.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxhawth Crescent, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain collapse, 27th January
item.description:
Drain collapse - hole getting bigger have to swerve to other side of road almost to miss it! Gets any bigger at risk of tyre punctures. Needs looking at Asap as two on Burnt ash lane one at the top as you enter road from Sundridge roundabout and one bit further down!! I notice this has been previously reported 18 December but still there - cannot add to previous report ! Is there any updates please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole getting worse near no 19, 27th January
item.description:
This pot hole has been here for a couple of weeks now and getting worse. There are lots of stones coming up and could hit parked cars.
